intro: Chrysocoma linosyris var. minor, commonly known as the lesser yellow-flowered chrysocoma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal or mountainous regions. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
